intro: Carruthersia glabra, commonly known as the smooth carruthersia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and leaves that are typically lance-shaped. It produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, a common floral structure in the Apiaceae family. Carruthersia glabra is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest margins.
